intro: Tinus calycosa, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a leathery texture, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of branches. Tinus calycosa is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
